ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
Basic Korean language grammar, vocab, and phrases I can use.
I feel much more comfortable reading & understanding the materials than before.
More Korean useful grammar and phrases
Progressed my Korean learning.
Korean language and cultural information
More basic grammar, listening, conversational skills.
Better speaking reading and understanding of Korean
Korean skills in reading, writing, speaking, listening. Increased vocabulary and grammar.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Encourages everyone to speak up but also be creative and fun while learning Korean language & culture. I especially loved learning the Korean culture.
Weaknesses: I think the textbook material may be slightly outdated (like the examples or dialogues)
Loved the learning structurefelt like I learned a lot from the course itself everyday without a ton of homework
Amazing professor, very fun class, lots of ways built into the course to make sure you are keeping up
Fantastic course! You can learn a lot if you assert yourself, but I feel like it's also easy to get by otherwise.
I loved it, I don't think it needs to be improved in any way. Professor Lim is amazing.
You get out what you put in. It is easy to coast by without trying very hard which was okay because I was happy to put in effort, but its not guaranteed to teach you a lot.
The instructor was fun and engaging, along with the content and structure of the class. I wish there were some more assignments outside of class to practice more.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. Professor is a lot of fun which is very important in language class as it may get quite stressful sometimes due to the complexity of some grammar and topics. I think the class allowed me to achieve a good balance of enjoying the classes & also challenging myself.
Yes!!! You learn a lot and have fun
Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a fun way to earn language credits, professors in this department are incredibly nice, supportive, fun to learn from
Great course if you want to learn Korean!
Yes! It is relatively low stress, but you learn a lot, and the professor is great. It's an awesome learning environment

YES! I took this as a second semester senior and at first was not sure if I would want to take a class that meets every day, but I am so so glad that I did. I always looked forward to going to class, and the workload was really low but I still learned a lot.
Yes. The Korean department is supportive and Im  is the best
Yes-- learning Korean at Yale is incredibly fun and interesting. The Korean department faculty are also very kind and are helpful instructors.

Absolutely. I think the Korean program here is phenomenal. The instructors are great, and I think you could go into the class with little or no interest in Korean and come out very interested in the language. You also get what you put into the class. But if you don't have hours every day to study the language it isn't required to do well in the class. This class is often the highlight of my day.
